HBA Boston - Women in Science Event: Career Transitions for Scientists: Possibilities and Pathways When: Wednesday, September 14th, 2011 Where: Hotel Marlowe, 25 Edwin Land Blvd, Cambridge, MA 02141 (Directions: http://www.hotelmarlowe.com/mapDirections.html Parking is available in the Cambridgeside Galleria Lot.) Register: http://www.hbanet.org (Onsite registration is allowed; online registration will remain open through the program date.) This event is designed to inform the audience about the wide avenue of career opportunities that exist in the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries. Representatives from leading biotech/pharma companies will share their experiences, identify skill sets needed, and discuss their journey to their current positions. Participants will have four 15-minute cycles to discuss how their current skill sets may apply to various job functions, and how to establish a path to a new career. A sampling of the career alternatives to be presented includes: research and development, pre-clinical development, business development, project and program management, quality control and quality assurance, translational medicine, regulatory affairs, medical science liaison, technical and medical writing, human resources for scientists, licensing and technology transfer, competitive intelligence, clinical operations, and commercial operations. Event is open to both HBA members and nonmembers. Learning Objectives:

1. Learn how scientific training can apply to new career paths within various areas of the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries.

 

2. Learn about alternate career paths from subject matter expert experiences

3. Identify key skill sets needed for career development

4. Learn about challenges and rewards of pursuing alternate career pathways

Agenda:  

5:30 – 6:00 PM Registration/Networking

6:00 – 6:15 PM Welcome/Opening Remarks

6:15 – 8:15 PM Program

8:15 – 9:00 PM Q&A/Closing Remarks/Evaluations
